content.description: Make bouldery moves under small roof to gain flake that joins obvious hand crack.  It's a big start, to access the first holds it may be necessary to step up on a cairn at the base.  The climb is short but strenuous, despite its appearance of being low-angle from the ground, the route does not let up until your reach a shelf at the top of the crack.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Climb protects really well.  Doubles of .5-1 inch cams is helpful.  The crux (hand crack on what looks like a slab) protects beautifully with two 1 inch cams.
content.location: Right side of the Shady Wall, left of the flaring chimney and left of "Afternoon Nap."

content.description: Climb the overhanging wall/corner to thin, steep lay back crack.  One bolt near the top.
Located on slab on the right side of the Shady Wall.   Start high, move up crack, move left (friction), crack becomes corner, zig zag to the top.
content.location: Start on slab right of "The Growth of the Soil."

content.description: The Shady Wall is the crag closest to the Bemis Road.  It is the furthest left and lowest wall.  The wall is about 40 feet tall.
